result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric R Allison

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric R Allison in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Eric R Allison.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ENTRY SHOULD HAVE BEEN DONE ON AUGUST 31, 2022. 

HELD OFF THE RECORD. 
Case was previously calendared for Status Conference on September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am. 
Defense counsel appeared in Court on August 31, 2022 and requested a Deferred Prosecution Agreement (DPA) hearing. State confirmed. 
Deferred Prosecution Agreement (DPA) hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am in Room 623 of the Courthouse. 
Clerk sent confirmation email to the parties.
Received and Filed by Attorney James Toran

Defendant Eric R Allison in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for Pretrial Conference.  
Discussion held off the record. Defense counsel has been retained by the defendant and will file the notice of retainer.
. Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-01-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Eric R Allison in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-29-2022 @2p
